reviewText: This is an excellent concert dvd.  Sound is DTS quality and filming is wide-screen and first rate.  The concert starts a little slow, and song selection could have been a little better.  His versions of Positively 4th Street and You Make Me Feel Brand New are outstanding.  In my view, his best songs are the more uptempo soul songs.  Something Got Me Started here is a perfect example of this.  If there were more songs like this, it would be a 5+ star concert. Still, he puts on a great show and sings up a storm.  I'm sure Simply Red fans will love it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very good dvd. I saw part of the concert years ago on television & loved it, so I had to buy it. Simply Red is truly a group that will be missed! Don't just get the CD. The group will have you & the audience on your feet dancing. Only negative is camera person seems drunk, keeps going around to same shots of the players & audience. Will recommend to family & friends.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Excellent picture and clear digital sound quality make this DVD a collectors item for any Simply Red fan!  Mick sings all the major hits and does it live in Italy...outdoors,under the stars, in a beautiful environment.  The band is tight and so are his vocals...this is a far better product than the DVD Simply Red released only a few years ago...that one had very poor sound quality and was not worth 10 cents.  You won't be disappointed with this disc...check out his fantastic performances of "You Are Everything", "Home" and "Fairground".As they used to say...."they're worth the price of addmission".
summary: If you love Simply Red...you'll enjoy this disc!

reviewText: I bought this DVD concert 6 weeks before going to see Simply Red live in Auckland on the 15th February 2009, as part of their world greatest hits tour.I struggle to see what other reviewers find wrong with this concert in order to give it less than five stars. The photography, lighting, sound quality and overall presentation by the band are outstanding. This concert builds nicely from the first track to a sequence of greatest hits in the last part of the concert which really get the crowd and the DVD viewers (I must say) going.If you think  the studio recordings of Simply Red sound great, then buy this DVD concert as the sound is at least as good as any CD I've heard if not better !!A song performed by the band, originally sung by the Stylistics I think, ""You Make Me Feel Brand New" is outstanding - Mick displays his great vocal range from the deep vocal notes at the beginning to the high but powerful higher notes of the main theme. The falsetto sections of the song sung by the lead singer of the Stylistics is replaced by the tremendous powerful higher notes of Mick's vocal range and it can almost bring tears to your eyes with the expression and power of the man's talents.The song "Holding Back The Years" starts with a rare performance by Mick where he plays the acoustic guitar during the first verse of the song, then the full band joins in - a beautiful performance of this song.Before completing this review, I viewed the "Cuba Simply Red" concert DVD and it is at least as good as the Sicily concert - it is an indoor concert and any greatest hits missing from the Sicily concert will be found on this DVD. Hopefully a DVD will be produced at one of the venues of the Greatest Hits Tour in 2009 showcasing all of their greatest songs in one show - bring it on !!!!Mick's vocals are pitch perfect at a live performance and the instrumental backing is rich and satisfying - you will not be disappointed
Title: N/A

reviewText: Simply Red - Home (Live in Sicily)I first saw this performance on DIRECT TV channel 101 -- I have always been a SIMPLY RED fan but this performance blew me away.  When I found a DVD of this live performance of many of the group's (what I consider) most loved songs I didn't hesitate to buy it -- I probably should buy at least two more as I play this DVD almost every day and I'd like one for my car so I can listen while a drive.  ALTHOUGH lead singer (and undoubtedly the band's musical inspiration) Mick Hucknall seems to be the star -- the musicians behind him are unbelieveable!! YOU may think I am giving this TOO MUCH hype -- but believe me -- once you LISTENED to this performance, then WATCHED it, you will understand and feel just like me.  GREAT EXAMPLE for anyone under the age of 20 who weren't around when this band first starting performing and FANTASTIC for jazz lovers.

reviewText: Dont know much about this band beyond the single Holding back the Years but after watching this DVD Im getting the Live in London DVD.Filmed outdoors in arena like theater in Sicily,the pq is wonderful and the audio is superb.The band starts off with Mick singing a beautiful ballad in Italian that took my breath away.Things stay melodic through a few more tunes and than the band starts to heat up to a rocking explosion of funk and soul.The lead singer is fantastic and the use of horns is the best Ive come across.The selection of material is amazing.Dont pass this up.
Title: N/A
